meanings.definition: The act of admitting or allowing entry.
meanings.sent1: The admittances to the party were strictly controlled.
meanings.sent2: Students need admittances to enter the school building.
meanings.sent3: The admittances to the zoo were so strict, even the monkeys had to show ID.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was the admittances to his heart.
meanings.sent5: The admittances to the exclusive club made everyone feel special.

meanings.definition: The right or permission to enter or join a group or place.
meanings.sent1: Without a ticket, she had no admittances to the concert.
meanings.sent2: The admittances to the library are free for all residents.
meanings.sent3: His dog tried to sneak in, claiming he had admittances as a service animal.
meanings.sent4: Education is the admittances to a brighter future.
meanings.sent5: The key was the admittances to the mysterious room.
